content: super scrappy socks by becky greene yarn fingering weight sock yarn scraps between 70-120 gms needles 2 75 mm or size to obtain gauge gauge 8 sts and 11 row = 1 notions stitch markers if desired sizes 7 8 9 10 circumference unstretched note these socks are designed to use up leftover sock yarn in particular i wanted to use up variegated and self-striping yarns as solid color yarns are easier to incorporate into color work i chose semi-coordinating colors but that is entirely knitter s preference i also chose one color black to knit for all of the transitions if you do this make sure that your solid contrast color is a strong contrast with your other leftover yarns to ensure the best effect copyright 2018 becky greene page �1 of �4 note 2 the following directions are for a basic top-down heel-flap sock my personal vanilla sock recipe feel free to substitute your own favorite generic sock pattern and incorporate the color work and transitional suggestions that follow note 3 start knitting the sock with scrap #1 i found that my scraps were long enough that i wanted to incorporate a color work pattern at roughly halfway through the scrap do so if you wish when you get near the end of a scrap maybe a yard left start knitting one of the color work patterns most of them have a line drawn halfway through the pattern where you will switch to the next leftover bit for most of the patterns this will make enough of a line with the contrast color that the transition between variegated/striped yarns isn t completely weird looking cuff cast on 56 64 72 80 sts join for working in the round being careful not to twist rnds 1-15 *k2 p2* around round 16 k knit leg in stockinette stitch to desired length working the color work charts as desired when you change yarns heel row 1 rs *sl 1 k1* across 28 32 36 40 sts turn row 2 ws sl 1 p across turn repeat row 1-2 until heel flap measures between 2-2 5 inches turn heel row 1 sl1 k14 18 20 24 ssk k1 turn row 2 sl1 p3 7 7 11 p2tog p1 turn row 3 sl1 k to 1 st before gap ssk k1 turn row 4 sl1 p to 1 st before gap p2tog p1 turn repeat row 3 and 4 until all heel sts are used up 16 20 22 26 heel sts left gusset round 1 k across heel sts pick up sts along edge of heel flap plus 1 in the corner between the heel flap and instep to avoid holes k across instep sts pick up 1 st in the corner between the heel flap and instep pick up sts along opposite heel flap k copyright 2018 becky greene page �2 of �4 across sole sts and first side of heel flap ready to knit the instep pm for new start
